H0.text: Storing sunlight in the leaves is why soil is important to a forest.

H1.text: Attracts insects that eat leaves is why soil is important to a forest.

H2.text: Provides nutrients to the trees is why soil is important to a forest.

H3.text: Soil warms the air around the trees, making it important to a forest.

A4.text: Soil provides minerals and water to plants according to several processes involved in plant nutrition.

A5.text: Soil provides readily available nutrients to plants and animals by converting dead organic matter into various nutrient forms.
